series_description: This series documents vital information of decedents. This series may include, but is not limited to: decedent's name, of death, date of birth, Social Security number, case file number, cause of death, and pathologist's name.

This series documents a decedent's cause and manner of death. This series may include, but is not limited to: ME's autopsy report, toxicology report, view diagram, scene evidence receipt, personal effects receipt, identification of unknown body, cremation certificate, report of gross findings, child death investigation form, and notice of ME case.

This series documents log in/out information for the decedents that are brought into the morgue. This series may include, but not limited to: decedent's name, transport company, funeral home, and date and time decedent was brought in and from the ME's facility.

This series documents information received for cases that did not fall under the jurisdiction of the medical examiner. This series may include, but is not limited to: medical records, law enforcement agency reports, emergency services reports, prescription monitoring records, non-medical examiner death certificates, and correspondence.

This series documents the donation of cadavers for advancement at medical schools and other institutions in Virginia. This series may include, but is not limited to: donor records, transportation authorization forms, and quarterly reports.
